title: Fear and Brisket for Jews at the DNC
message:
This is a guy who peddles antisemitic stereotypes.”Meanwhile Jewish Democrats were literally hiding out at the DNC.
Liberal Jews kvelling over Kamala’s brisket did not ask which church Emhoff attends and which temple Kamala visits.
And if Kamala can cook a brisket, who really needs a country, safety, self-respect or the ability to attend events at the DNC without being harassed by masked supporters of killing Jews?
Not a single Jewish Democrat stood up to Biden for suggesting that the mobs of Hamas supporters calling for the murder of Jews had “a point”.
In an echo of Esau, Jews at the DNC had a choice between brisket and their birthright.

title: The war comes home to a Brooklyn bookstore
message:
It’s a bookstore — especially an independent bookstore.
And then, a bookstore employee canceled Rabbi Bachman.
He is certainly on the left side of the Jewish political and Zionist spectrum, calling himself an “anti-occupation Jew.”Then, Rabbi Bachman.
People get to say that certain Jews are acceptable, and certain Jews are not — that certain kinds of Judaism are acceptable and certain kinds of Judaism are not.
I am glad the bookstore will reschedule the event with Joshua Leifer and Rabbi Bachman.

title: Antisemitism in the Academy : A DNC Panel Tries to Tackle Jewish Student Fears on Campus - U . S . News
message: Antisemitism in the Academy: A DNC Panel Tries to Tackle Jewish Students' Fears on CampusA progressive pro-Israel group called 'Zioness' hosted an event at the Democratic National Convention aimed at understanding the issues facing Jews on university campuses, and on how universities should enforce rules against hate speech while protecting the right to protest

title: What I learned when a Brooklyn bookstore canceled a discussion of Judaism over my Zionism
message:
But first, after being canceled, we all stood on the sidewalk for a few minutes, getting our wits about us.
Countless emails and messages included the words, “We may not agree on everything, Andy, but …” Nothing more needed to be said.
There is a story that the historian George Mosse’s students used to tell about the 1960s anti-war protests in Madison, Wisconsin.
Oh to have the chance to engage this bookstore censor over which particular Zionism she was objecting to.
Share this: TwitterFacebookWhatsAppEmailRabbi Andy Bachman is a rabbi who has led congregations in Brooklyn and Manhattan.

message:
“[H]istory will not forget that the Qatari Al-Jazeera was and still is a platform for leaders of terrorism….
Al-Jazeera, meanwhile, continues to serve as a mouthpiece of terrorist organizations, especially Hamas, whose leaders are frequently given a platform to promote terrorism.
In 2017, Qatar and the US signed a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) on combatting the financing of terrorism.
They noted that although the US has known about Qatar’s malign activities for years, it has failed to strategically act on them.
This has allowed Qatar to advance policies that are harmful to the interests of the US and its allies in the Middle East and beyond.

title: Adam Kirsch picks apart the theory of  settler colonialism
message:
Most who saw the phrase “settler colonialism” scrawled on a protest sign or tossed into a social media post probably didn’t grasp its full meaning.
“Settler colonialism” refers to the genocidal displacement of indigenous populations and their replacement with settlers.
And in his slender new book, “On Settler Colonialism: Ideology, Violence, and Justice,” he not only picks apart the argument that Israel is a settler colonial state but goes after the larger project of settler colonial studies — often to devastating effect.
“But what if there were a country where settler colonialism could be challenged with more than words?” Kirsch writes.
Some activists who decry settler colonialism end up in the same place, advocating for a two-state solution.
